ud1.9:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gayā on Gayā Head
ud1.9:1.3_0: Now at that time—during the cold spell when the snow falls in the dead of winter—many dreadlocked ascetics plunged in and out of the Gayā river. Plunging and showering, they served the sacred flame, thinking:
ud1.9:2.1_0: The Buddha saw them plunging in and out.
ud1.9:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud1.9:4.2_0: no matter how many people bathe there.
ud1.9:4.3_0: Those who have truth and principle:
ud1.9:4.4_0: they are pure, they are brahmins.”
